result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kirsten A. Majetich

defendant.name: Majetich, Kirsten A.
defendant.address: 3336 Twin Lake Road, Little Canada, MN 55127

records.addlTxt: DE came to the front window to ask about her final Atty bill, and to say she wouldn't be able to make her Nov payment until 11/11/2022. Clerk informed her the order was still proposed, and that her payment on the 11th would be fine, but that she should definitely pay that day. olg
for Pymt of Atty Fees filed by Atty Dobbe totalling $293.66. jaf
for Pymt of Atty Fees filed by Atty Dobbe. jaf
Def left vm regarding extension on atty fees. Clerk tried calling back, ph.# on file not working. KEF
Signed by all parties on this date. E: Atty & DA. jaf
Filed by Atty Dobbe. jaf

11:11 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Kirsten A. Majetich in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Kirsten A. Majetich.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker for ADA Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CM417 & 22TR1757.  Court reviews files.  ADA Becker recites joint agreement to 12 Month DJOC.  Atty Dobbe makes arguments. Court makes statements.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Possession of THC in 22CM417.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CM417.  Court withholds sentence in favor of DJOC on Ct 1 in 22CM417 for one year. Court makes modification on DJOC which is for DE to obtain GED. Diversion staff to provide quarterly updates.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & 3 in 22CM417 and outright dismisses 22TR1757. DE to continue making current monthly payments toward payment plan.  Adjourned at 11:36 AM. bph

The original document was titled: COMPAS

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:58 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Brian Smestad with Student Intern Alison Casey DF ATTY: Travis Satorius for today Defendant Kirsten A. Majetich in court. Includes 22CM417 and 22TR1757. DE states she contact PD and was told that it wasn't a criminal matter. Court advises DE to contact PD again, as this is a criminal matter. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty Satorius states DE won't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Waive reading. NG. Bond argument; bond ordered.  gll
